description:
This two-vehicle crash occurred on a two-way, three-lane, not physically divided roadway.
                        The posted speed limit was 72kph (45mph). There were no atmospheric conditions at the time of
                        the incident and the roadway was dry.


                        Vehicle one (V1) was exiting a parking lot, which had a gradient of +2. Vehicle two (V2) was
                        going straight on a level roadway, passing the parking lot from where V1 was exiting. There were
                        no traffic control devices present at the location of this crash.


                        V1 a 1996 Jeep Grand Cherokee was attempting to make a left onto the westbound roadway from a
                        parking lot from a convenience store. V2 a 1992 Chevy Cavalier was traveling east on the main
                        roadway at approximately 64kph (40mph). The front left of V2 made contact with the left rear of
                        V1. The impact caused V1 to spin counter clockwise before coming to final rest in the westbound
                        lane. V2 continued further ahead before coming to rest in between lanes one and two of the
                        roadway. Vehicle two was removed from the scene due to moderate damage, whereas vehicle one
                        suffered minor damage and was removed by the owner.


                        Numerous attempts and messages could not generate an interview with the driver of V1 who had
                        already departed the scene upon my arrival. However, through information collected by the police
                        officer, it appears that the driver failed to look both ways before entering the roadway. Based
                        on this information, the Critical Precrash Event was coded this vehicle traveling, turning left
                        at intersection (from parking lot). The Critical Reason for the Critical Precrash Event was
                        coded as recognition error, inadequate surveillance, in that the driver failed to look both
                        ways. As far as the details of fatigue, medication, or possible distractions are concerned, this
                        information remains unknown. The driver of vehicle one did not suffer any injuries as a result
                        of this crash.


                        The passenger of V2 was taken to the hospital for possible injuries, and the driver accompanied
                        them before my arrival. An attempt was made to contact the driver of V2 using the number
                        provided on the Police Accident Report. Unfortunately the person who answered claimed that it
                        was not the residence of the driver in question. A match could not be found using sources such
                        as the phone book or the Internet. Because no interview could be obtained, any other factors
                        that may have contributed to this crash are unknown at this time. The Critical Precrash Event
                        coded to this vehicle was other vehicle encroachment (from driveway, turning in opposite
                        direction). There was no Critical Reason coded to this vehicle.
